page.title: 02THE LANDSCAPE OF TURTON
page.content: The area divides into two contrasting sections, with the residential area of Egerton to the S and S.W.and open countryside over the remainder. The area is hilly, increasingly so to the north, and is a mixture of open moorland and reforested areas. Three landscaped man made reservoirs add to the overall attractiveness of the area. The area permits the development and conservation of a wide variety of flora, animal and bird life. There are large reforested areas of coniferous trees, and numerous copses of natural deciduous trees. The area is rocky, with many outcrops and disused quarries. The soil is thin, moorland areas being covered by clumps of springy grass. 7 miles of footpaths permit the enjoyment of the area.
